SEARCH
Package com.example.haboob

Class EventsListTest

java.lang.Object
com.example.haboob.EventsListTest
public class EventsListTest extends Object
Unit tests for EventsList logic that can be executed without Firestore or Android.

This test suite validates all in-memory behaviors of EventsList, including:

  • Finding events by ID
  • Filtering events by tags (case-insensitive)
  • Retrieving events by organizer
  • Finding waitlist membership by entrant
  • Determining which events are still "live"

The tests use the in-memory constructor new EventsList(true) to avoid Firebase initialization, and mock Event objects created directly with setters.

Place this file under: 

src/test/java/com/example/haboob/EventsListTest.java

    Method
    Description
    void
    setUp()
    Initializes a new in-memory EventsList and populates it with three mock Event objects for testing.
    void
    testFilterEvents_caseInsensitive_andContainsAll()
    Tests EventsList.filterEvents(java.util.List) for: Case-insensitive tag matching Requirement that all tags in the input are present in an event Handling of empty or null input (returns copy of full list)
    void
    testGetEntrantWaitlistEvents()
    Tests EventsList.getEntrantWaitlistEvents(String) to ensure that it correctly identifies events where a user appears on the waitlist.
    void
    testGetEventByID_found()
    Verifies that EventsList.getEventByID(String) successfully retrieves an event when the ID exists in the list.
    void
    testGetEventByID_notFound()
    Verifies that EventsList.getEventByID(String) returns null for unknown or null event IDs.
    void
    testGetLiveEvents_nullOrFutureEndDateAreLive()
    Tests EventsList.getLiveEvents() to confirm that: Events with null end date are treated as live Events with future end date are live Events with past end date are not included
    void
    testGetOrganizerEvents()
    Tests EventsList.getOrganizerEvents(String) to ensure it returns only the events belonging to the specified organizer.

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      Initializes a new in-memory EventsList and populates it with three mock Event objects for testing.

    • testGetEventByID_found

      public void testGetEventByID_found()
      Verifies that EventsList.getEventByID(String) successfully retrieves an event when the ID exists in the list.

    • testGetEventByID_notFound

      public void testGetEventByID_notFound()
      Verifies that EventsList.getEventByID(String) returns null for unknown or null event IDs.

    • testFilterEvents_caseInsensitive_andContainsAll

      public void testFilterEvents_caseInsensitive_andContainsAll()
      Tests EventsList.filterEvents(java.util.List) for:
      • Case-insensitive tag matching
      • Requirement that all tags in the input are present in an event
      • Handling of empty or null input (returns copy of full list)

    • testGetOrganizerEvents

      public void testGetOrganizerEvents()
      Tests EventsList.getOrganizerEvents(String) to ensure it returns only the events belonging to the specified organizer.

      Also validates behavior for null and empty IDs.

    • testGetEntrantWaitlistEvents

      public void testGetEntrantWaitlistEvents()
      Tests EventsList.getEntrantWaitlistEvents(String) to ensure that it correctly identifies events where a user appears on the waitlist.

    • testGetLiveEvents_nullOrFutureEndDateAreLive

      public void testGetLiveEvents_nullOrFutureEndDateAreLive()
      Tests EventsList.getLiveEvents() to confirm that:
      • Events with null end date are treated as live
      • Events with future end date are live
      • Events with past end date are not included
